52 Oh, how much better it would be to be neighbors 53 of those people I mentioned, and to have your borders 54 at Galluzzo and Trespiano,
55 than to have them inside and endure the stench 56 of the peasant from Aguglione, and the one from Signa, 57 who is always sharp-eyed for a bargain!

61 then the Florentine who has become a merchant and moneychanger 62 would have turned to Simifonti, 63 where his grandfather went begging;

**Sanskrit:**

55 yathāntar-gataḥ sahet durgandhim 56 Aguglione-grāma-jātasya, Signa-jātasya ca, 57 ye vikraye nīcakau cakṣuṣau.
58 Yadi janaḥ loke 'dhamaḥ syāt 59 na caesarasya dvitīyā mātā, 60 kintu putrasya mātā kṛpayā,
61 tathā kṛtaḥ fiorentino vikrīṇāti ca vikaroti ca, 62 yaḥ Simifonti pravṛttaḥ syāt, 63 yatra pitāmahaḥ bhikṣām yācate sma;
